item.title: One ICML 2024 Paper Accepted
item.description: Our paper, 'Physics-Informed Neural Network Policy Iteration: Algorithms, Convergence, and Verification' has been accepted to the 2024 International Conference on Machine Learning, Vienna. Many thanks to all the authors for their hard work and dedication!

item.title: Invited Session Proposal Accepted for the ITSC 2024
item.description:
The proposed invited session "AI-Enhanced Safety-Certifiable Autonomous Vehicles" has been accepted for the Our work on robustly complete stochastic abstractions was presented at the 27th IEEE International Conference on Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITSC), which will be held from September 24 to 27, 2024, in Edmonton, Canada.

Organizers

  • Yiming Meng, Coordinated Science Laboratory, University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign
  • Melkior Ornik, Coordinated Science Laboratory & Aerospace Engineering, University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign
  • Xiaopeng Li, Civil and Environmental Engineering, University of Wisconsin-Madison
  • Heye Huang, Civil and Environmental Engineering, University of Wisconsin-Madison
  • Hangyu Li, Civil and Environmental Engineering, University of Wisconsin-Madison

We acknowledge

  • The IEEE Emerging Transportation Technology Testing (ET3)
  • The Transportation Research Board (TRB) Emerging Technologies Subcommittee

as joint sponsors of this session.

item.title: One ADHS 2024 Paper Accepted
item.description: Our paper, 'LyZNet with Control: Physics-Informed Neural Network Control of Nonlinear Systems with Formal Guarantees' has been accepted to the 8th IFAC Conference on Analysis and Design of Hybrid Systems (ADHS), Boulder.

item.title: Paper accepted to IEEE Transaction on Automatic Control
item.description: After nearly two years of peer review, the paper 'Stochastic Lyapunov-Barrier Functions for Robust Probabilistic Reach-Avoid-Stay Specifications' has finally been accpeted for the publication in `IEEE Transaction on Automatic Control`.

item.title: Multiple Conference Papers Accepted
item.description:
Two papers

  • Zubov-Koopman Learning of Maximal Lyapunov Functions
  • Compositionally Verifiable Vector Neural Lyapunov Functions for Stability

have been accepted to the 2024 American Control Conference (ACC), Toronto.

The tool paper

  • LyZNet: A Lightweight Python Tool for Learning and Verifying Neural Lyapunov Functions and Regions of Attraction

has been accepted to the 2024 ACM International Conference on Hybrid Systems: Computation and Control (HSCC) in Hong Kong.

item.title: Joining A New Research Group at UIUC
item.description: I joined the LEADCAT (LEArning, Decision, Control, AuTonomy) research group at the Aerospace Engineering Department, University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign, and began my role as a Postdoctoral Research Associate.

item.title: Work Presented at IUTAM
item.description: Our work on estimating the maximal Lyapunov exponent for stochastic semilinear PDEs was presented at the IUTAM Symposium on Nonlinear Dynamics for Design of Mechanical Systems Across Different Length/Time Scales, held in Tsukuba, Japan.

item.title: Journal Papers Pusblished
item.description:
Two journal papers

  • Robustly Complete Finite-State Abstractions for Control Synthesis of Stochastic Systems
  • Hopf bifurcations of moore-greitzer pde model with additive noise

have been published in IEEE Open Journal of Control Systems and Journal of Nonlinear Science, respectively.

item.title: Work Presented on Stochastic Abstractions
item.description: Our work on robustly complete stochastic abstractions was presented at the 9th Meeting on System and Control Theory, held in Waterloo, Ontario, Canada.
